intro: Gymnogramma longisora, commonly known as the long-leaf gymnogramma, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds that are typically arranged in a bipinnate structure. The plant produces spores in sporangia that are clustered on the undersides of its leaves, a common feature among ferns. Gymnogramma longisora thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it a valuable subject for studies on fern morphology and ecology.
